problem: The height of a ball when it is thrown off a cliff can be represented by the equation $h=45-7t-6t^2$, where $t$ is time in seconds. In how many seconds will the ball reach a height of 25 feet?
solution:
If we plug in 25 for $h$, we get \begin{align*} 25& =45-7t-6t^2
\\\Rightarrow\qquad 6t^2+7t-20& =0
\\\Rightarrow\qquad (3t-4)(2t+5)& =0
\end{align*}The two possible values of $t$ are $\frac43$, and $-\frac52$. Since the time can only be a positive value, the answer must be $\boxed{\frac43}$.
chatgpt_solution:
We set $h=25$ feet and solve for the corresponding $t$: \begin{align*}
25=45-7t-6t^2&\implies 6t^2+7t-20=0\\
&\implies (2t+5)(3t-4)=0\\
&\implies t=-\frac{5}{2}\text{ or }t=\frac{4}{3}.
\end{align*}We disregard the negative root because $t$ represents time. Thus, $\boxed{\frac{4}{3}\text{ seconds}}$ or 1 and $\frac{1}{3}$ seconds have elapsed.
